content.2: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
content.3: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers
content.4: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.
content.10: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
content.11: They ravished the women in Zion,
content.12: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.
content.13: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
content.14: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.
content.15: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.
content.17: For this our heart is faint; for these
content.18: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
content.20: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever,
content.21: Turn thou us unto thee, O
content.22: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.
